definition: (after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: As for our redeemer, the LORD of hosts is his name, the Holy One of Israel.
sentences.chinese: 我们救赎主的名是万军之耶和华以色列的圣者。

sentences.english: Ordinary people responded positively to the pilgrims who came into their villages.
sentences.chinese: 老百姓对来到他们村庄的朝圣者明确地作出了反应。

sentences.english: Ruled by the Turks until1916, Jidda has long been used as a port by Moslem pilgrims making the journey to Mecca.
sentences.chinese: 吉达长期以来是穆斯林朝圣者通往麦加城的旅行港口。

sentences.english: The palmer has been Guyon's guide up to this point, his teacher.
sentences.chinese: 他的老师，即那位朝圣者只将他带到洞口。

sentences.english: 35So it is stated elsewhere: "'You will not let your Holy One see decay.'
sentences.chinese: 又有一篇上说，你必不叫你的圣者见朽坏。

sentences.english: Shamans were the holy men of early human civilization.
sentences.chinese: 巫师是早期人类文明中的圣者。

sentences.english: He is thus called a disciple of the noble ones undertaking the Deva-Uposatha.
sentences.chinese: 因此他被称为修持天神布萨的圣者弟子。

sentences.english: They envied Moses also in the camp, and Aaron the saint of the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 他们又在营中嫉妒摩西，和耶和华的圣者亚伦。

sentences.english: Many Moslem pilgrims go to Mecca every year.
sentences.chinese: 每年很多回教朝圣者到麦加。

sentences.english: Pilgrims no longer come to leave notes or flowers.
sentences.chinese: 朝圣者也不再来此留言或献花。

sentences.english: Bue one man loved the pilgrim soul in you.
sentences.chinese: 唯独一爱你那朝圣者的心。

sentences.english: Have not saints lips, and holy palmers too?
sentences.chinese: 圣者与朝圣者难道没有唇？

sentences.english: Have not saints lips, and holy palmers too?
sentences.chinese: 圣者与朝圣者难道没有唇？

sentences.english: Many of the worshippers were from the neighboring state of Punjab.
sentences.chinese: 很多朝圣者来自临近的旁遮普邦。

sentences.english: The pontiff was speaking to pilgrims at his summer palace.
sentences.chinese: 教皇正在其夏宫向朝圣者布教。

sentences.english: As palmers' chat makes short their pilgrimage.
sentences.chinese: 正如朝圣者闲谈，使漫漫长途缩短。

definition: honored sir (a person of higher status or seniority, or a Buddhist monk)
Mahayana, the Great Vehicle/Buddhism based on the Mayahana sutras, as spread to Central Asia, China and beyond/also pr. [Da4 cheng2]
Nirvana (in Buddhist scripture)/Lord Brahma (the Hindu Creator)
god/spirit/demon/occult or supernatural entities in general
the most honorable/the most respected/supreme/(archaic) the emperor
Holy Son/Jesus Christ/God the Son (in the Christian Trinity)
elder/term of respect for a Buddhist monk
